description: Single storey rear extension and conversion of roof space to habitable use involving conversion of roof from hip to gable end with gable end window and to include a rear dormer and 2 front roof lights
decision_conditions: The proposed development would by virtue of the design, scale and mass would not appear subservience to the existing dwelling and would appear incongruous, dominant and visually intrusive in the rear garden environment and front street scene contrary to policies 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (2016), policy DC61 of the London Borough of Havering LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD 2008, and the London Borough of Havering Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD 2011.

The proposed roof extensions would, by reason of its design, scale, height and bulk be unneighbourly which would give rise to an uncomfortable overbearing effect which would be harmful to neighbouring properties contrary to Policy DC61 of the London Borough of Havering LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD 2008, and the London Borough of Havering Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD 2011.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: Consideration was given to seeking amendments, but given conflict with adopted planning policy, notification of intended refusal and the reason(s) for it was given to Mr Arthur Leborgne via email on 23rd December 2020.
